meanings.definition: A person or thing that rejuvenates.
meanings.sent1: The gardeners were the rejuvenators of the park, planting new flowers and trees.
meanings.sent2: The spa offers various rejuvenators such as facials and massages.
meanings.sent3: The old clock was the rejuvenators of the room, ticking loudly and keeping everyone awake.
meanings.sent4: Laughter is the rejuvenators of the soul, bringing joy and light to our lives.
meanings.sent5: Music can be a powerful rejuvenators, lifting our spirits and energizing us.

meanings.definition: A substance or treatment that restores youth or vitality.
meanings.sent1: The skincare product claimed to be a rejuvenators, promising to reduce wrinkles and fine lines.
meanings.sent2: Many people believe in the power of natural rejuvenators like aloe vera and coconut oil.
meanings.sent3: The fountain of youth was said to be a magical rejuvenators, granting eternal youth to those who drank from it.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as a rejuvenators, making her seem younger and full of energy.
meanings.sent5: Exercise can be a great rejuvenators, keeping our bodies strong and healthy.
